source:
#The <service:Positive> is great - LRB - maybe even borderline nagging but at least you get attention - RRB - ,
#the <desserts:Positive> are excellent and the <coffee:Positive> is so very good . . .

1-- The  Model is bert uncased from Microsoft called microsoft/mdeberta-v3-base, improved from  improves the BERT and RoBERTa models.

2-- The model was fine tunned on inline reviews from restaurants for aspects sentiment. 

    >> The model does first the aspect extraction.
    
    >> Then, sentiment classification. 

3-- Inefrence model was made.  

    >> Each tweet is considered as a review and the aspect sentiment is applied.

source:
aspects_list=[]
sentiments_list=[]
for i in pos_bert_aspects.index:
    aspects= pos_bert_aspects.loc[i,"aspect"] 
    aspects= aspects.replace('[','').replace(']','')
    aspects= aspects.replace('"','')
    aspects=aspects.split(",")
    #aspects= aspects.replace('"','')
    aspects=[i.replace('"','') for i in aspects ]
    sentiments= pos_bert_aspects.loc[i,"sentiment"]
    sentiments= sentiments.replace('[','').replace(']','')
    sentiments= sentiments.replace('"','')
    sentiments=sentiments.split(",")
    #sentiments= sentiments.replace('"','')
    sentiments=[i.replace('"','') for i in sentiments ]
    for j in aspects:
        j= j.replace('"','')
        j= j.replace("'",'')
        j=j.replace(" ", "")
        for t in sentiments:
            t= t.replace('"','')
            t= t.replace("'",'')
            t=t.replace(" ", "")
            aspects_list.append(j)
            sentiments_list.append(t)
print('# Number of Positive aspect:', len(aspects_list))

pos_apect_bert_frame = pd.DataFrame(
    {'apects': aspects_list,
     'sentiment': sentiments_list

neW_aspects=[]
neW_Sentiments=[]
for i in pos_apect_bert_frame.index:
    asp=pos_apect_bert_frame.loc[i, "apects"]
    senti=pos_apect_bert_frame.loc[i, "sentiment"]
    new_aspect= asp.replace('[','').replace(']','')
    new_aspect= new_aspect.strip("'")
    new_senti= senti.replace('[','').replace(']','')
    new_senti= new_senti.strip("'")
    neW_aspects.append(new_aspect)
    neW_Sentiments.append(new_senti)

                  "lesbian"]    
def bertsentiment_percentage(term):
    Ttotal_aspect_sentiment=0
    pos=0
    neg=0
    neut=0
    #retireve corresponding tweet from the posiitve or negative frame:
    for i in pos_apect_bert_frame.index:
        asp=pos_apect_bert_frame.loc[i, "cleaned_aspects"]
        senti=pos_apect_bert_frame.loc[i, "cleaned_sentiment"]
        if term == asp:
            Ttotal_aspect_sentiment=Ttotal_aspect_sentiment+1
            if senti=='Positive':
                pos=pos+1
            elif senti=='Neutral':
                neut=neut+1
            elif senti=='Negative':
                neg=neg+1
    print("Positive percentage: {} %".format(100*(pos)/(Ttotal_aspect_sentiment)))
    print("Neutral percentage: {} %".format(100*(neut)/(Ttotal_aspect_sentiment)))  
    print("Negative percentage: {} %".format(100*(neg)/(Ttotal_aspect_sentiment)))

!pip install import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from wordcloud import WordCloud
my_list=["one", "one two", "three"]

#convert list to string and generate
unique_string=(" ").join(my_list)
wordcloud = WordCloud(width = 1000, height = 500).generate(unique_string)
plt.figure(figsize=(15,8))
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.axis("off")
plt.savefig("your_file_name"+".png", bbox_inches='tight')
plt.show()
plt.close()
